Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a fish living in a water environment like a lake, river, pond, or ocean.
The student can label the parts of the water environment that the fish needs, such as water and air.
The student can include and label other plants or animals that live in the same environment as the fish.
The student can illustrate and describe the materials or resources that the fish and other living things need to survive in their habitat.
The student can show the relationship between the fish and its environment by illustrating how the fish uses the resources in the water to meet its needs.
The student can identify how the drawn environment, including all labeled parts, is a system that supports the life of the fish and other living things.
